title: Patient API Routes
description:
Create REST API Endpoints for Patient Management System

Implement a complete set of RESTful API routes to handle patient data operations with proper security, validation, and error handling.

Requirements:
- Create the following endpoints:
  - POST /api/patients - Create a new patient record
  - GET /api/patients - Retrieve all patients (with pagination support)
  - GET /api/patients/:id - Retrieve a specific patient by ID
  - PUT /api/patients/:id - Update an existing patient record
  - DELETE /api/patients/:id - Delete a patient record

- Implement authentication and authorization:
  - Require valid authentication token for all endpoints
  - Verify user has appropriate permissions for each operation
  - Return 401 for unauthenticated requests, 403 for unauthorized access

- Add input validation:
  - Validate required fields (name, date of birth, contact information)
  - Enforce data type constraints (email format, phone number format, valid dates)
  - Sanitize inputs to prevent injection attacks
  - Return 400 with descriptive error messages for invalid inputs

- Include proper error handling:
  - Return 404 when patient ID not found
  - Handle database connection errors gracefully
  - Return consistent error response format with appropriate status codes

- Additional considerations:
  - Include pagination, filtering, and sorting for GET /api/patients
  - Ensure sensitive patient data is never exposed in logs
  - Add rate limiting to prevent abuse
  - Document endpoints with example requests/responses
